intro: Beilschmiedia pseudomicropora, commonly known as the Philippine beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and dense, glossy foliage. The plant typically grows in lowland to montane rainforests, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its small, fragrant flowers are followed by edible, round berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Beilschmiedia pseudomicropora plays a vital role in maintaining the ecological balance of its native habitat.
